name: Magnesia carbonica
Relationship: Antidotes: ARS.; MERC.Compare: RHEUM.; KREOS.; ALOES; CHEIRANTHUS - Wall flower - (deafness, otorrhoea, nose stopped up at night from IRRITATION OF CUTTING WISDOM-TEETH.Complementary: CHAM.
Modalities: Worse: warmth of bed; change of temperature; cold wind or weather; every three weeks; rest
Better: warm air; walking in open air

Head: Itching of scalp worse in damp weather
Pain above margin of right orbit
Sticking pain in the side of the head on which he lies as if the hair was pulled; worse, mental exertion
Black motes before eyes
Stomach: Eructations sour, and vomiting of bitter water
Desire for fruits, acids, and vegetables
Stool: Milk passes undigested in nursing children
Sour, with tenesmus  constipation after mental shock or severe nervous strain
Green, watery, frothy, like a frog-pond's scum
Abdomen: Very heavy; contractive, pinching pain in right iliac region
Face: Pain in malar bone, worse during rest, night
Swelling of malar bone with pulsating pain, worse exposure to cold wind
Tearing pain in one side; worse, quiet; must move about
Toothache, especially during pregnancy; worse at night; worse, cold and quiet
Respiratory: Tickling cough, with salty, bloody expectoration
Constrictive pains in chest, with dyspnoea
Mouth: Sticking pain in throat; hawking up fetid, pea-colored particles
Female: Menses too late and scanty, thick, dark, like pitch; mucous leucorrhoea
Menses flow only in sleep; more profuse at night , or when lying down; cease when walking
Before menses, coryza and nasal stoppage
Skin: Itching vesicles on hands and fingers
Sleep: Unrefreshing; more tired on rising than on retiring
Extremities: Tearing in shoulders as if dislocated
Whole body feels tired and painful, especially legs and feet
Right shoulder painful, cannot raise it
Ears: Feeling of distention of middle ear

details: Gastrointestinal catarrh, with marked acidity. Often used with advantage for complaints arising in people who have been taking this drug to sweeten the stomach. Is frequently indicated in children; whole body smells sour, and disposed to boils. Broken-down, worn-out women, with uterine and climacteric disorders. With numbness and distention in various parts and nerve prostration. Sensitive to the least start, noise, touch, etc. Affections of the antrum of Highmore. Effects of shock, blows, mental distress. Sense of numbness; nerve prostration; tendency to constipation after nervous strain; SENSITIVE TO LEAST TOUCH, it causes starting, or cold winds or weather or from excess of care and worry with constipation and heaviness. Intense neuralgic pains.
